mrkn commented on issue #6139: ARROW-7515: [C++] Rename nonexistent and non_existent to not_found
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6139#issuecomment-576480431
 
 
   @nealrichardson Could you tell me the way to fix the following warning?
   
   https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6139/checks?check_run_id=395390711#step:5:988
   ```
   * checking for code/documentation mismatches ... WARNING
   Codoc mismatches from documentation object 'open_source':
   open_source
     Code: function(path, filesystem = c("auto", "local"), format =
                    c("parquet", "arrow", "ipc"), partitioning = NULL,
                    allow_not_found = FALSE, recursive = TRUE, ...)
     Docs: function(path, filesystem = c("auto", "local"), format =
                    c("parquet", "arrow", "ipc"), partitioning = NULL,
                    allow_non_existent = FALSE, recursive = TRUE, ...)
     Argument names in code not in docs:
       allow_not_found
     Argument names in docs not in code:
       allow_non_existent
     Mismatches in argument names:
       Position: 5 Code: allow_not_found Docs: allow_non_existent
   ```

nealrichardson commented on issue #6139: ARROW-7515: [C++] Rename nonexistent and non_existent to not_found
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6139#issuecomment-576781438
 
 
   @mrkn edit r/man/open_source.Rd to match [the inline doc source you edited](https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6139/files#diff-2186b99dd95ca2ebd24d27b3eb44b319L214). Better would be to run `make doc` from the `r/` directory to regenerate the docs, though that requires that you have R set up and dependencies installed.

mrkn commented on pull request #6139: ARROW-7515: [C++] Rename nonexistent and non_existent to not_found
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6139#discussion_r396455575
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/plasma/test/client_tests.cc
 ##########
 @@ -503,7 +503,7 @@ TEST_F(TestPlasmaStore, RefreshLRUTest) {
 TEST_F(TestPlasmaStore, DeleteTest) {
   ObjectID object_id = random_object_id();
 
-  // Test for deleting non-existence object.
+  // Test for deleting nonexistent object.
 
 Review comment:
   The word "nonexistence" is a noun, so I guess "nonexistence object" means an object that represents the state of nonexistence.
   On the other hand, the word "nonexistent" is an adjective, so I guess "nonexistent object" means an object that is absent.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

users@infra.apache.org

 TEST_F(TestPlasmaStore, DeleteTest) {
   ObjectID object_id = random_object_id();
 
-  // Test for deleting non-existence object.
+  // Test for deleting nonexistent object.
 
 Review comment:
